node.title: Alternative route for Mt Messenger Bypass would have saved forest
node.description: Questions are being asked about whether 30 hectares of native forest really needs to be felled to make way for a long-awaited bypass in northern Taranaki.

node.title: Man arrested after chaotic driving in Timaru
node.description: A man has been arrested after a patrol car was rammed and another car smashed into during wild scenes on the roads in central Timaru this morning.

node.title: Dog reunited with owner after fleeing storm
node.description: A dog which fled its Queenstown home during a violent storm was found 6 kilometres away - to the delight of its owner.

node.title: Deluge along South Island's West Coast as Aucklanders feel the heat
node.description: Auckland recorded its hottest April temperature since 1998 yesterday afternoon.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 18 further deaths and 10,294 new community cases
node.description: Another 18 people with Covid-19 have died and there are 10,294 new community cases in New Zealand today, the Ministry of Health says.

node.title: Goodhue back for Crusaders, but All Blacks prop ruled out
node.description: All Blacks midfielder Jack Goodhue makes his Super Rugby return for the Crusaders this weekend, but they've lost All Blacks prop Joe Moody to injury.

node.title: Solomon Islands-China security deal needs scrutiny - Mahuta
node.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Nanaia Mahuta says the new Solomon Islands security arrangement with China is unwelcome and should be open to regional scrutiny. Audio

node.title: Thousands flee as Arizona wildfire almost triples in size
node.description: A wind-driven Arizona wildfire almost tripled in area on Wednesday after burning dozens of structures and forcing thousands to flee their homes in a drought-hit rural area.

node.title: Tairāwhiti locals fed up with impact of constant storms
node.description: Locals say Tairāwhiti has had a constant hammering of bad weather - with at least five storms in the past year shutting off roads and cutting off communities.

node.title: Local health networks set up as reforms steam ahead
node.description: The minister announced the move this morning, saying it would help retain a local voice as the reforms replace the 20 DHBs with a single entity.

node.title: MIQ assessment adds 'insult to injury' for women forced to give birth abroad
node.description: Women forced to give birth overseas late last year, without any family support, say it is abhorrent health officials thought MIQ wasn't justified at that time.

node.title: State Highway 1 in Levin closed after crash
node.description: State Highway 1 in Levin is closed after two vehicles collided on Thursday afternoon.

node.title: Former Honduran president to be extradited to U.S.
node.description: Hernández will face weapons and drug trafficking charges in New York.

node.title: Frustration building over $11m new bridge sitting idle
node.description: Frustration is mounting that a long-awaited new bridge connecting two North Island districts can't yet be used.

node.title: Man City back on top of EPL
node.description: Manchester City leapfrogged Liverpool back to the Premier League summit thanks to three second-half goals against Brighton.

node.title: Shannon incident: Police seek sightings of man walking north of town
node.description: Police say the incident appears to be isolated.

node.title: NZ's first commercial trial of hydrogen-powered vehicles
node.description: Toyota New Zealand is partnering with several local companies to roll out the country's first commercial trial of hydrogen-powered vehicles.

node.title: Police 'mishandling' of youth resulted in broken wrist, cut to face - IPCA
node.description: Police have accepted their conduct was unreasonable during an arrest in which a man suffered a broken wrist and a cut to his forehead.

node.title: Capitol briefly evacuated over Nationals pregame parachute show
node.description: According to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, the Federal Aviation Administration failed to inform Capitol Police of the pre-planned flyover.

node.title: Scotland's top politician on menopause: 'There's still a lot of stigma'
node.description: Nicola Sturgeon has revealed that she is anxious about how going through menopause will affect her.

node.title: Arrest after investigation into methamphetamine near school
node.description: Police have arrested a 41-year-old man after an investigation into methamphetamine dealing near a primary school in Blenheim.

node.title: Woman arrested after assault at Hamilton Kmart
node.description: Police have arrested a woman in relation to an assault at the central Hamilton Kmart store on Saturday.

node.title: More Hector's dolphins found dead
node.description: Two more Hector's dolphins have been found dead on South Island beaches.

node.title: 2 of 3 USS George Washington sailors who died within one week died by suicide
node.description: The cause of death of the third sailor remains under investigation.

node.title: Grocery retailer allows public to track progress on Commission's recommendations
node.description: A major grocery retailer will allow the public to track how it's progressing against recommendations in the Commerce Commission's recent market study into the sector.

node.title: Mike Hopkins, longtime CBS News staffer, dies unexpectedly
node.description: Hoppy, as he was known to his colleagues, is being remembered as "a CBS News institution" and "the heart of this network."

node.title: Inflation rate expected to hit a new 30-year high
node.description: Households that have had to pinch their pennies tighter than usual won't be surprised when inflation figures released later this morning show the biggest annual rise in more than 30 years. Audio

node.title: Rust film producers fined over fatal shooting on set
node.description: The producers of a film whose cinematographer was accidentally shot dead on set by Alec Baldwin have been fined and strongly criticised by authorities for failing to follow safety guidelines.

node.title: Many civilians still trapped in Mariupol as Russian deadline expires; refugees top 5 million
node.description: About 1,000 civilians remain trapped at a steel plant where Ukrainian forces are making their last stand in the besieged city of Mariupol, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said, after a Russian ultimatum…

node.title: Covid-19: One in four adults not boosted as demand dries up
node.description: The Covid-19 booster vaccine campaign has all but stalled, with demand drying up and the rate of booster coverage having declined.
